citation.article-title: Campylobacter cinaedi (sp. nov.) and Campylobacter fennelliae (sp. nov.): two new Campylobacter species associated with enteric disease in homosexual men.

p.s: Description of Campylobacter fennelliae sp. nov.
Campylobacter fennelliae (N. L. gen. n. fennelliae, for the technologist who first isolated these organisms from rectal swabs of homosexual men)
Campylobacter fennelliae as the name for CLO-2 strains.

Characteristics of this species are as follows [14]: microaerophilic growth at 37 C but not at 25 C or 42 C; no growth aerobically or anaerobically; catalase produced; growth in 1% glycine; growth in 0.04% triphenyltetrazolium chloride but not in 2% NaCl; hippurate not hydrolyzed; nitrate not reduced; hydrogen sulfide not produced in triple-sugar-iron agar; growth inhibited by 30 μg disks of naladixic acid and 30 μg disks of cephalothin; and distinctive hypochlorite odor of colonies.
The G + C content of the DNA is 370%-38%.
The type strain (231) has been deposited at the American Type Culture Collection, Rockville, Md and is designated ATCC 35684.
